caption.title: Inter-model relationships associated with global-mean upper-ocean temperature changes.
caption.p: ( a) Scatterplot of the global-mean climatological (1971–2000) depth of the 14 °C isotherm in the ALL forcing model simulations (grey) and observations (red) versus the trend in average temperature anomalies above the 14 °C isotherm (T 14°C). Also shown is the multi-model ensemble mean (black). ( b) The same as ( a) but for the global-mean trend in the depth of T 14°C versus difference between the trends in average ocean temperature anomalies above 220 m (T 220m) minus T 14°C. The line-of-best-fit, R and p-values are also shown for both relationships, where the regression lines are both statistically significant at the 99% confidence level.
